headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM NEW-GRANADA.; New-Granadian Proposal for Annexation to the United States. Ratification of the Treaty with the United States.

docs.abstract: Propositions of Sen. Gonzales looking to annexation to US
docs.lead_paragraph: The British steam propeller Saladin arrived at this port on the 31st ult., from Liverpool, having touched at Savanilla on the 29th. An English passerger on board, Mr. DUFFIELD, who left Bogota on the 9th March, says that the Convention between New-Granada and the United States was ratified by the Senate, under the following circumstances:

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; IMPORVEMENT IN CONSOLS. DECLINE IN COTTON---BREADSTUFFS DULL Consolidation of the Anglo-French Alliance. Proceedings in the British Parliament. How the Appointment of the Duke de Malakoff is Received in England. ARRIVAL OF THE AMERICA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steams ?ip America, Captain MODIE, from Liverpool, at, 9 A. M. of Saturday, March 27, arrived at Halifa' at 3 1/2 P.-M., on Friday, April 9. The America has had heavy westerly gales since April 1. The America reports March 28, passed in the Channel steamship Europa, from New-York,

docs.snippet: De Lamartine has written a letter to La Presse, in which he denies that there is any plaglarism in his work of Graziella. The distinguished litterateur says that the passages against Bonapartism in 1811, which characterize his book, ought to convince...
docs.lead_paragraph: De Lamartine has written a letter to La Presse, in which he denies that there is any plaglarism in his work of Graziella. The distinguished litterateur says that the passages against Bonapartism in 1811, which characterize his book, ought to convince his accusers that he has not robbed M. De Forbin of his opinions.

headline.main: THE COST OF LIVING.; Book-Keepers and their Salaries Once More.
